element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm completes the information of a raster layer that has cells without data. Those cells are completed using values from the nearest neighbour cell with valid data.
This algorithm should be used when filling a layer that contains a non-continuous variable, and specially those layers with cualitative data sucha as a layer with a land-use classification. In that case, the usual void filling algorithm should not be used, since it might assign values to a cell that do not exist on the original layer, and those values might be meaningless. Using a nearest neighbour method guarantees that all values assigned to no-data cells are meaningful.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: Output raster layer in which there are no cells without data.
